com.yworks.yfiles.layout

Class MultiStageLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yworks.yfiles.layout.MultiStageLayout
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ILayoutAlgorithm
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AspectRatioTreeLayout, BalloonLayout, CircularLayout, ClassicOrganicLayout, ClassicTreeLayout, FamilyTreeLayout, GraphTransformer, HierarchicLayout, HierarchicLayoutCore, OrganicLayout, OrthogonalLayout, RadialLayout, SeriesParallelLayout, SingleCycleLayout, TreeLayout

    public abstract class MultiStageLayout
extends Object
implements ILayoutAlgorithm
    An abstract base class for layout algorithms that provides services to simplify and decompose the input graph before it is passed to the core layout algorithm itself.

    Subclasses of this layout algorithm have to provide implementations for the abstract method applyLayoutCore(LayoutGraph). It invokes the actual layout routine of this layout algorithm.

    Concept

    This class provides a configurable pipeline that contains ILayoutStages that add preprocessing steps and/or postprocessing steps to the layout algorithm. MultiStageLayout provides some predefined ILayoutStages, that simplify the input graph for the layout algorithm and complement the result. It is also possible to add custom ILayoutStages which are executed before or after the predefined ones.

    Each ILayoutStage in the pipeline wraps its successor. When the layout pipeline is processed, the preprocessing code of the preceding ILayoutStage is executed before the code in the current ILayoutStage while the postprocessing code is executed afterwards.

    The pipeline of predefined ILayoutStages of MultiStageLayout (when all are activated) causes the following sequence of steps:

    1. Hides the group nodes.
    2. Hides all except for the induced subgraph.
    3. Decomposes the graph into its connected components. Performs steps 4-12 on each component.
    4. Prepares for label placement.
    5. Prepares the layout for an orientation change.
    6. Hides self-loops.
    7. Hides parallel edges.
    8. Invokes the layout algorithm on the simplified graph.
    9. Un-hides and routes parallel edges.
    10. Un-hides and routes self-loops.
    11. Completes orientation change of the layout.
    12. Assigns label positions.
    13. Arranges the connected components of the graph.
    14. Un-hides non-induced subgraph.
    15. Un-hides the group nodes.

    In order to take effect, a stage that is not already activated by default needs to be activated using the corresponding method, e.g., HideGroupsStageEnabled. Vice versa, a stage can also be deactivated, if necessary.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultiStageLayout

        public MultiStageLayout()
        Creates a new MultiStageLayout instance with default settings.

    • Method Detail

      • appendStage

        public void appendStage(ILayoutStage stage)
        Appends the given ILayoutStage to the layout pipeline.

        Stages that are added with this method will be invoked at the very end of the layout pipeline. This means after all prepended ILayoutStages, all predefined stages, and all previously appended ILayoutStages, but just before the invocation of the layout algorithm.

        Parameters:
        stage - the ILayoutStage instance to be added
        See Also:
        removeStage(ILayoutStage), prependStage(ILayoutStage)

      • applyLayout

        public void applyLayout(LayoutGraph layoutGraph)
        Calculates a layout for the given graph and applies it directly to the graph.

        This method executes all activated ILayoutStages in the layout pipeline as well as the layout algorithm.

        Specified by:
        applyLayout in interface ILayoutAlgorithm
         
        The given graph will not be copied during the layout process and the layout will be immediately applied to the given graph. This method is not side effect free in the sense that the order of edges or nodes in the input graph may change during the layout process.
        Parameters:
        layoutGraph - the input graph
        See Also:
        appendStage(ILayoutStage), prependStage(ILayoutStage), applyLayoutCore(LayoutGraph)

      • applyLayoutCore

        public abstract void applyLayoutCore(LayoutGraph graph)
        Invokes the core layout algorithm.

        This method should be implemented by subclasses in order to perform the layout routine of the layout algorithm.

        Parameters:
        graph - the input graph

      • checkNodeSize

        protected void checkNodeSize(LayoutGraph g)
        Checks the sizes of the nodes to be non-zero.
        Parameters:
        g - The graph to check.

      • disableAllStages

        public void disableAllStages()
        Deactivates all predefined ILayoutStages so that upon applyLayout(LayoutGraph) only the layout algorithm will be executed.
         
        The ILayoutStages prepare the graph for the layout algorithm, i.e., they can temporarily hide elements. If the layout algorithm cannot handle those elements, e.g., group nodes, it may not work well on the input graph.

      • getComponentLayout

        public ILayoutStage getComponentLayout()
        Gets the ILayoutStage that arranges the connected components of an input graph.
         
        This ILayoutStage needs to be activated in order to take effect.
         
        The default implementation passes all connected components to the layout algorithm separately. After all components are layouted, it arranges them in relation to each other. Custom implementations should respect that the layout algorithm may not be able to handle multiple connected components.
        Default Value:
        The default value is ComponentLayout
        Returns:
        the ILayoutStage instance
        See Also:
        setComponentLayoutEnabled(boolean), ComponentLayout, setComponentLayout(ILayoutStage)

      • getHideGroupsStage

        public ILayoutStage getHideGroupsStage()
        Gets the ILayoutStage that hides the group nodes of the input graph.
         
        This ILayoutStage needs to be activated in order to take effect.
         
        The default implementation temporarily removes all group nodes during core layout and resizes them when inserting them again afterwards. Custom implementations should also hide the group nodes because the core layouter might not be able to handle them.
        Default Value:
        The default value is HideGroupsStage
        Returns:
        the ILayoutStage instance
        See Also:
        setHideGroupsStageEnabled(boolean), HideGroupsStage, setHideGroupsStage(ILayoutStage)

      • getLabeling

        public ILayoutStage getLabeling()
        Gets the ILayoutStage that places the labels of the input graph.
         
        This ILayoutStage needs to be activated in order to take effect.
        Default Value:
        The default value is GenericLabeling. An instance of GenericLabeling with MaximumDuration set to 0.
        Returns:
        the ILayoutStage instance
        See Also:
        setLabelingEnabled(boolean), GenericLabeling, setLabeling(ILayoutStage)

      • getLayoutOrientation

        public LayoutOrientation getLayoutOrientation()
        Gets the main orientation of the layout.

        This is a convenience method that configures the orientation layout stage.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified orientation does not match a default layout orientation
         
        This method will take effect only if the layout stage that modifies the orientation is an instance of OrientationLayout. It has to be overridden to support ILayoutStages that do not extend OrientationLayout.
        Default Value:
        The default value is LayoutOrientation.TOP_TO_BOTTOM
        Returns:
        one of the default layout orientations
        See Also:
        setOrientationLayout(ILayoutStage), setOrientationLayoutEnabled(boolean), setLayoutOrientation(LayoutOrientation)

      • getOrientationLayout

        public ILayoutStage getOrientationLayout()
        Gets the ILayoutStage that modifies the orientation of a computed layout.
         
        In order to configure this ILayoutStage using LayoutOrientation, it is necessary that an instance of OrientationLayout is used.
        Default Value:
        The default value is OrientationLayout
        Returns:
        the ILayoutStage instance
        See Also:
        setOrientationLayoutEnabled(boolean), setLayoutOrientation(LayoutOrientation), OrientationLayout, setOrientationLayout(ILayoutStage)

      • getParallelEdgeRouter

        public ILayoutStage getParallelEdgeRouter()
        Gets the ILayoutStage that routes parallel edges.
         
        This ILayoutStage needs to be activated in order to take effect.
         
        The default implementation temporarily removes all parallel edges during core layout and routes them when inserting them again afterwards. Custom implementations should also hide the parallel edges because the core layouter might not be able to handle them.
        Default Value:
        The default value is ParallelEdgeRouter
        Returns:
        the ILayoutStage instance
        See Also:
        setParallelEdgeRouterEnabled(boolean), ParallelEdgeRouter, setParallelEdgeRouter(ILayoutStage)

      • getSelfLoopRouter

        public ILayoutStage getSelfLoopRouter()
        Gets the ILayoutStage that routes self-loops.
         
        This ILayoutStage needs to be activated in order to take effect.
         
        The default implementation temporarily removes all self-loops during core layout and routes them when inserting them again afterwards. Custom implementations should also hide the self-loops because the core layouter might not be able to handle them.
        Default Value:
        The default value is SelfLoopRouter
        Returns:
        the ILayoutStage instance
        See Also:
        setSelfLoopRouterEnabled(boolean), SelfLoopRouter, setSelfLoopRouter(ILayoutStage)

      • getSubgraphLayout

        public ILayoutStage getSubgraphLayout()
        Gets the ILayoutStage that constrains the layout process to a subgraph of the input graph.
         
        This ILayoutStage needs to be activated in order to take effect.
        Default Value:
        The default value is SubgraphLayout
        Returns:
        the ILayoutStage instance
        See Also:
        setSubgraphLayoutEnabled(boolean), SubgraphLayout, setSubgraphLayout(ILayoutStage)

      • isComponentLayoutEnabled

        public boolean isComponentLayoutEnabled()
        Gets whether or not the ILayoutStage used for arranging the components of the graph is activated.

        This ILayoutStage should be deactivated if the layout algorithm is able to handle several connected components.

        Default Value:
        The default value is true. The stage that arranges connected graph components is activated.
        Returns:
        true if the stage that arranges the graph components is activated, false otherwise
        See Also:
        setComponentLayout(ILayoutStage), ComponentLayout, setComponentLayoutEnabled(boolean)

      • isHideGroupsStageEnabled

        public boolean isHideGroupsStageEnabled()
        Gets whether or not the ILayoutStage used for hiding group nodes is activated.

        This ILayoutStage should be deactivated if the layout algorithm handles group nodes itself.

        Default Value:
        The default value is true. The stage responsible for hiding group nodes is activated.
        Returns:
        true if the stage used for hiding group nodes is activated, false otherwise
        See Also:
        setHideGroupsStage(ILayoutStage), HideGroupsStage, setHideGroupsStageEnabled(boolean)

      • isLabelingEnabled

        public boolean isLabelingEnabled()
        Gets whether or not the ILayoutStage used for placing the labels of the input graph is activated.

        This ILayoutStage may be activated to apply a generic labeling algorithm to the input graph. It will then try to find the best locations for the labels in the layout calculated by the layout algorithm. When the stage is deactivated, the labels are ignored or placed by an integrated labeling of the layout algorithm.

        Default Value:
        The default value is false. The stage responsible for label placement is deactivated.
        Returns:
        true if the stage responsible for placing the labels is activated, false otherwise
        See Also:
        setLabeling(ILayoutStage), GenericLabeling, setLabelingEnabled(boolean)

      • isOrientationLayoutEnabled

        public boolean isOrientationLayoutEnabled()
        Gets whether or not the ILayoutStage that modifies the orientation of the layout is activated.

        This ILayoutStage may be deactivated if the orientation is irrelevant for the layout or if the core layout algorithm already handles the layout orientation by itself.

         
        If the current layout orientation is LayoutOrientation.TOP_TO_BOTTOM, the orientation of the layout will not be modified.
        Default Value:
        The default value is true. The orientation ILayoutStage is activated.
        Returns:
        true if the stage that modifies the orientation is activated, false otherwise
        See Also:
        setOrientationLayout(ILayoutStage), setLayoutOrientation(LayoutOrientation), OrientationLayout, setOrientationLayoutEnabled(boolean)

      • isParallelEdgeRouterEnabled

        public boolean isParallelEdgeRouterEnabled()
        Gets whether or not the ILayoutStage used for routing parallel edges is activated.

        This ILayoutStage should be deactivated if the layout algorithm handles parallel edges itself.

        Default Value:
        The default value is true. The stage that routes parallel edges is activated.
        Returns:
        true if the stage responsible for routing parallel edges is activated, false otherwise
        See Also:
        setParallelEdgeRouter(ILayoutStage), ParallelEdgeRouter, setParallelEdgeRouterEnabled(boolean)

      • isSelfLoopRouterEnabled

        public boolean isSelfLoopRouterEnabled()
        Gets whether or not the ILayoutStage used for routing self-loops is activated.

        This ILayoutStage should be deactivated if the layout algorithm handles self-loops by itself.

        Default Value:
        The default value is true. The stage that routes self-loops is activated.
        Returns:
        true if the stage responsible for routing self-loops is activated, false otherwise
        See Also:
        setSelfLoopRouter(ILayoutStage), SelfLoopRouter, setSelfLoopRouterEnabled(boolean)

      • isSubgraphLayoutEnabled

        public boolean isSubgraphLayoutEnabled()
        Gets whether or not the ILayoutStage used for constraining the layout process to a subgraph of the input graph is activated.

        This ILayoutStage may be activated if the layout algorithm should be applied only to a specific part of the graph. The remaining graph will stay unchanged.

        Default Value:
        The default value is false. The stage that constrains the input graph to a subgraph is deactivated.
        Returns:
        true if the stage that constrains the input graph to a subgraph is activated, false otherwise
        See Also:
        setSubgraphLayout(ILayoutStage), SubgraphLayout, setSubgraphLayoutEnabled(boolean)

      • prependStage

        public void prependStage(ILayoutStage stage)
        Prepends the given ILayoutStage to the layout pipeline.

        Stages that are added with this method will be invoked at the very beginning of the layout pipeline. This means before all previously prepended ILayoutStages, all predefined stages, and all appended ILayoutStages.

        Parameters:
        stage - the ILayoutStage instance to be added
        See Also:
        removeStage(ILayoutStage), appendStage(ILayoutStage)

      • removeStage

        public void removeStage(ILayoutStage stage)
        Removes the given ILayoutStage from the layout pipeline.

        This method can only remove ILayoutStages that have been previously added using appendStage(ILayoutStage) or prependStage(ILayoutStage). Predefined ILayoutStages can be deactivated separately.

        Parameters:
        stage - a ILayoutStage to be removed from the layout pipeline
        See Also:
        prependStage(ILayoutStage), appendStage(ILayoutStage), setSelfLoopRouterEnabled(boolean), setParallelEdgeRouterEnabled(boolean), setOrientationLayoutEnabled(boolean), setSubgraphLayoutEnabled(boolean), setLabelingEnabled(boolean), setHideGroupsStageEnabled(boolean), setComponentLayoutEnabled(boolean)

      • setComponentLayout

        public void setComponentLayout(ILayoutStage value)
        Sets the ILayoutStage that arranges the connected components of an input graph.
         
        This ILayoutStage needs to be activated in order to take effect.
         
        The default implementation passes all connected components to the layout algorithm separately. After all components are layouted, it arranges them in relation to each other. Custom implementations should respect that the layout algorithm may not be able to handle multiple connected components.
        Default Value:
        The default value is ComponentLayout
        Parameters:
        value - the ILayoutStage instance
        See Also:
        setComponentLayoutEnabled(boolean), ComponentLayout, getComponentLayout()

      • setComponentLayoutEnabled

        public void setComponentLayoutEnabled(boolean value)
        Sets whether or not the ILayoutStage used for arranging the components of the graph is activated.

        This ILayoutStage should be deactivated if the layout algorithm is able to handle several connected components.

        Default Value:
        The default value is true. The stage that arranges connected graph components is activated.
        Parameters:
        value - true if the stage that arranges the graph components is activated, false otherwise
        See Also:
        setComponentLayout(ILayoutStage), ComponentLayout, isComponentLayoutEnabled()

      • setLayoutOrientation

        public void setLayoutOrientation(LayoutOrientation value)
        Sets the main orientation of the layout.

        This is a convenience method that configures the orientation layout stage.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified orientation does not match a default layout orientation
         
        This method will take effect only if the layout stage that modifies the orientation is an instance of OrientationLayout. It has to be overridden to support ILayoutStages that do not extend OrientationLayout.
        Default Value:
        The default value is LayoutOrientation.TOP_TO_BOTTOM
        Parameters:
        value - one of the default layout orientations
        See Also:
        setOrientationLayout(ILayoutStage), setOrientationLayoutEnabled(boolean), getLayoutOrientation()

      • setOrientationLayout

        public void setOrientationLayout(ILayoutStage value)
        Sets the ILayoutStage that modifies the orientation of a computed layout.
         
        In order to configure this ILayoutStage using LayoutOrientation, it is necessary that an instance of OrientationLayout is used.
        Default Value:
        The default value is OrientationLayout
        Parameters:
        value - the ILayoutStage instance
        See Also:
        setOrientationLayoutEnabled(boolean), setLayoutOrientation(LayoutOrientation), OrientationLayout, getOrientationLayout()

      • setOrientationLayoutEnabled

        public void setOrientationLayoutEnabled(boolean value)
        Sets whether or not the ILayoutStage that modifies the orientation of the layout is activated.

        This ILayoutStage may be deactivated if the orientation is irrelevant for the layout or if the core layout algorithm already handles the layout orientation by itself.

         
        If the current layout orientation is LayoutOrientation.TOP_TO_BOTTOM, the orientation of the layout will not be modified.
        Default Value:
        The default value is true. The orientation ILayoutStage is activated.
        Parameters:
        value - true if the stage that modifies the orientation is activated, false otherwise
        See Also:
        setOrientationLayout(ILayoutStage), setLayoutOrientation(LayoutOrientation), OrientationLayout, isOrientationLayoutEnabled()

      • setParallelEdgeRouter

        public void setParallelEdgeRouter(ILayoutStage value)
        Sets the ILayoutStage that routes parallel edges.
         
        This ILayoutStage needs to be activated in order to take effect.
         
        The default implementation temporarily removes all parallel edges during core layout and routes them when inserting them again afterwards. Custom implementations should also hide the parallel edges because the core layouter might not be able to handle them.
        Default Value:
        The default value is ParallelEdgeRouter
        Parameters:
        value - the ILayoutStage instance
        See Also:
